Member Function Documentation

tx_oop_Color_Utils::createHexColor ( $  v1,
$  v2,
$  v3,
$  uppercase = false 
)

Creates an hexadecimal color.

This method is used to create an hexadecimal color representation from RGB (Red-Green-Blue), HSL (Hue-Saturation-Luminance) or HSV (Hue-Saturation-Value) values.

Parameters:
number The first value (red or hue, depending of the method)
number The second value (green or saturation, depending of the method)
number The third value (blue, luminosity or value, depending of the method)
boolean Return value in uppercase
Returns:
string The hexadecimal value of the color

tx_oop_Color_Utils::modifyHexColor ( $  color,
$  v1,
$  v2,
$  v3,
$  uppercase = false 
)

Modifies an hexadecimal color.

This method is used to modify an hexadecimal color representation by adding RGB (Red-Green-Blue), HSL (Hue-Saturation-Luminance) or HSV (Hue-Saturation-Value) values.

Parameters:
string The original color (hexadecimal)
number The first value (red or hue, depending of the method)
number The second value (green or saturation, depending of the method)
number The third value (blue, luminosity or value, depending of the method)
boolean Return value in uppercase
Returns:
string The hexadecimal value of the modified color
